column3: any wrong in the manner in which the learned Magistrate has considered the

column2: facts and the way in which he has applied the law in this instance.

column3: Therefore,  it  is  not  necessary  to  interfere  with  the  Judgment  of the
learned High Court Judge, who affirmed the Order of the learned Magistrate.
Accordingly,  no  ground exists  which justifies the  intervention of this

column2: Court  to  set  aside  the  Judgment  of the
19.03.2007. and the Order of the learned Magistrate dated 22.08.2005.

column3: F or the above reasons,  I hold that there is no merit in this Appeal and
